times.name: Julie Moronuki
times.title: Keynote - The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Metaphor
times.bio: Julie Moronuki learned Haskell while writing Haskell Programming from First Principles. She has degrees in philosophy and linguistics and formerly worked as a language teacher and librarian. Her interests include the intersections of linguistics, logic, and programming, as well as improving functional programming instruction and outreach. Currently she is writing a second book, The Joy of Haskell, and is a co-founder of Type Classes (typeclasses.com). In her spare time she homeschools her two children and makes too much jam.
